intro: Lagenocarpus guianensis f. gracilior, commonly known as the slender-leaved guianensis, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, making it a common understory species in tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
